intro: Mezia huberi, commonly known as the alpine meadow beauty, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its slender stems bear small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Mezia huberi is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
